page.title: 18EMPLOYMENT ACORNSPRING WORKS
page.content: Acorn Spring Works moved to Freshwater in 1963 from Colnbrook,it had started in 1939 in Acton,London which was on the Acorn Telephone Exchange and it is believed that the company took it's name from this.Due to labour problems a new location was needed away from Colnbrook and the site of the Railway Station of Freshwater was for sale and this seemed ideal.{FRESHWATER STATION was opened to passengers on the 20th July 1889,it was the terminus for the last line of the network of the island railways.In 1955 the railway was closed down by Dr Beeching and was demolished in 1962. The postal address for Acorn Spring Works is Hook Hill, originally spelt with an'e'after Robert Hooke who was born in 1635,son of the curate of All Saints Church. He published the first laws of elasticity from which the spring deriv
